The scarf has an extradimensional space within the folds of its fabric that can only be reached while it's worn. The space holds 60 pounds of material, not exceeding a volume of 6 cubic feet. The scarf always weighs 1 pound, regardless of its contents.

Despite being able to place items in the scarf, reaching back into it fails to return them to your grasp. The frayed ends of the scarf are actually wisp-like hands that slowly twist and curl on their own. While wearing the scarf, you can mentally command the hands as a bonus action to reach into the extradimensional space and retrieve a stored item.
Placing the scarf inside an extradimensional space created by a "bag of holding", "portable hole", or similar item instantly destroys both items and creates a singularity.

item.name: Belt of Returning
entries: A finely crafted dark leather belt with three loops, each decorated with a shard of sapphire.

The magic of the belt leaves an invisible mark on the surface of the weapons stowed in each loop and invisibly inscribes the name of the item on the sapphire shard. Three one-handed weapons with the thrown property can be 'attuned' to the belt.
When a weapon, from the belt, is thrown at an object or creature, hit or miss, the weapon will return to the belt at the end of your turn.

item.name: Eye of the Fiendlord (WIP)
entries: While you are attuned to the eye, once a day, you can cast see invisibility on yourself at will. You can choose to see through its magically enhanced lens using a bonus action.
Looking through the eye grants you {@sense darkvision} of up to 120 feet, and are able to peer through both magical and nonmagical darkness using it.

entries.name: Curse
entries: When you attune to the Eye of the Fiendlord, you are suddenly overcome with the urge to see what it sees. Make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a success, you're able to resist the enchantment and are aware of the curse's effects, but are not attuned to it. On a failure, you forcefully tear out one of your own eyes, taking {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage, allowing the Eye of the Fiendlord to crawl into its place. If you are already missing an eye, you are simply compelled to allow the eye to crawl into the empty socket.

You can see normally while the Eye of the Fiendlord remains in your socket, but you can choose to close your other eye to see through its magically enhanced lens using a bonus action. The eye moves slower than a normal eye, leaving slight trails and motion blurs behind it as you look through it. While looking only through the Eye of the Fiendlord, you have disadvantage on any attack you make as well as ability checks that rely on depth perception. You can open your other eye and regain your normal vision using another bonus action.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The eye is a gruesome familiar. As an action, you can command the eye to crawl out of its socket and move independently of you. Use the abilities described in the {@spell find familiar|PHB} spell when commanding the Eye of the Fiendlord. The eye has five hit points, an AC of 12, movement and climbing speed of 20 feet, does not require air to breathe and has a +6 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the eye is slain or you dismiss it, it reappears inside your open eye socket with a sickly sound. If it was slain, you cannot use its magical sight or command it as a familiar again until the following dusk.

Targeting the eye with the {@spell remove curse|PHB} spell or unattuning to it causes the eye to pull itself out of the socket and crawl away. Slaying the eye while it is unattuned to a creature destroys the item.

item.name: Red Claw's Regalia (WIP)
entries: This tough dragon scale robe is miraculously insulated and comfortable. While wearing the robe, you gain the following benefits:

items: You can withstand extreme temperatures without any additional protection.
Your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22.
You have resistance to fire damage.
You can walk on lava as if it were solid ground, without taking fire damage from it. Ending your turn on lava causes you to sink into it and take fire damage as normal.

entries: The hem of this robe glimmers with slowly shifting embers. While wearing this robe, your steps leave behind small motes of magical fire and scorched earth. The flames and marks left behind are harmless and disappear 1 second after they appear.

item.name: Wrath of Zeus
entries: Gold plate bracers. On a roll of 9 or 11, your unarmed strike explodes with {@spell thunderclap|XGE}. On a roll of 10, it backfires and you take {@damage 1d6} lightning damage. The spell's DC equals to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.

item.name: Mage Guardian's Helm
entries: A full plate armor helmet without any openings. While you are wearing it, you are blinded, deafened, and mute. If you know the ways of Mage Guardian, you can activate the helm's 60-foot Blindsight. Provides resistance to psychic damage and you have advantage on saving throws against being  {@condition charmed} and any magical effect that puts you to sleep.

item.name: Webgrip Rucksack
entries: This spider leather bag is lined with a thin layer of adhesive web.

Items stored inside the bag are held in place by the web, preventing stored items from clattering around or being removed without permission. While you're wearing the bag, creatures other than you have disadvantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks to steal from the bag. The bag and its eight straps adhere to the surface they're pressed against, such as a creature's torso or the wall of an inn. If you're wearing the bag, you can gently remove the straps from your body as an action. Other creatures that attempt to wrench the bag from you make any Strength checks to do so with disadvantage.

The bag can hold up to 8 cubic feet or 80 pounds. Spider leather is pliable and stretches easily, allowing the bag to shrink and grow to accommodate the objects placed inside to some degree. Even though the eyes adorning the bag are lifeless and unmoving. they still blink on a rare occasion.

item.name: Swiss Army Wand
entries: You're not sure who the Swiss are or why an army would need such a non-aggressive wand, but it seems useful enough. Never Leave Home Without It. This wand has 10 charges and it regains {@dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. You can expend 1 or more charges to cast one of the following spells from the wand:

item.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
entries: While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the {@spell magic missile|PHB} spell from it. For 1 charge, you cast the 1st-level version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend. The wand regains {dice 1d6+1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Clockwork Faefly
entries: This bronze clockwork mechanism is 2 inches long and has a glass vial under it. It whirs with the hum of tiny gears inside.
You can tap the head of the faefly twice as a bonus action. When you do, the mechanism flutters 5 feet in the air and emits the {@spell light|PHB} spell.

The faefly has AC 15 and 10 hit points and flies in this way until it falls to 0 hit points or another creature grasps it. If you move more than 3 feet from the hovering faefly, it follows you until it is within 3 feet of you.
If the {@spell mending|PHB} spell is cast on the faefly while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the faefly drops to 0 hit points, it can't be used again.

item.name: Clockwork Healerbee
entries: This pill-shaped magical mechanism is 2 inches long and made of brass. It has a pair of tiny wings that silently keep it aloft. It hovers up to 5 feet above the ground and does its best to stay at your side within your space.

The bee has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d6+2} expended charges daily at dawn. While the bee is within your space, you can speak its command word and expend up to 3 of its charges as a bonus action to command the bee to heal a creature that you can see within 20 feet of you. The bee flies to the creature's space and stings the creature, casting a {@spell healing word|PHB} for each expended charge. After healing the creature, the bee returns to your space.

It has AC 15, 10 hit points, and has resistance to all damage types. If the {@spell mending|PHB} spell is cast on the bee while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the bee drops to 0 hit points, it can't be used again.

item.name: Clockwork Inkbeetle
entries: This minuscule, mechanical beetle is 1 inch long and quietly whirs with a mix of magical and mechanical forces. Placing the beetle on a piece of parchment you hold or carry causes it to spring to life and begin tracking your travels. As you move, so does the beetle. It leaves behind a small line of ink that it generates. The ink immediately dries and doesn't dissolve in water. In addition. the beetle's small frame allows it to move even while enclosed in a book or similar enclosure without losing its sense of movement or direction.

The beetle has a dial on its underside. A creature can use the dial to select the scale in which the beetle moves. For each option, the beetle moves 1 inch in the same direction as you for every amount you move as shown on the dial, creating a map of your journey: 20 feet, 200 feet, 2 miles, or 20 miles. The beetle is immune to magical effects that would otherwise alter its sense of direction.

The beetle always knows which direction is North. When placed on a piece of parchment for the first time, it crouches down to stamp a small compass rose on the sheet before beginning to move. If the beetle runs out of space on the parchment to travel, it stops moving in that direction and emits a clicking sound that can be heard by creatures within 5 feet of it.

Attaching one {@item bands of the found and lost|canbrew|band of the found and lost} to the beetle while you wear the other allows the beetle to move and trace your movements in this way from afar so long as you are both on the same place of existence.

The Cartographer's Guild would hire small bands of adventurers to test their mettle on new and exciting expeditions provided they wear a single {@item bands of the found and lost|canbrew|band of the found and lost}.

item.name: Clockwork Mend-A-Pillar
entries: This segmented mechanical caterpillar is 5 inches long, weighs 1 pound, and is made of copper. It has several tiny copper legs that give it a 5-foot walking speed. Within it are multiple containers filled with silk filaments, spools of thread, dyes, and an incredibly strong adhesive. Each of these materials is expelled through a tube in its mouth, and it is equipped with a transmutation lens in its head that allows it to change the adhesive to various kinds of wood, metal, stone, or crystal.

As an action, you can speak the caterpillar's command phrase to cause it to repair a broken or torn object or area that it's set upon. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot across in more than 1 dimension, the caterpillar can create the material to repair it. The caterpillar then begins crawling over and repairing the object or area, taking 10 minutes for every cubic foot it repairs (minimum of 1 minute). The caterpillar can physically repair a magic item or construct, but can't restore magic to such an object. After the caterpillar finishes repairing an object or area, it stops moving and makes a soft chirping sound audible out to 30 feet. Once the caterpillar repairs 10 cubic feet of material, it can't be used again until 24 hours have passed.

The caterpillar is considered a magical object and is not a creature. It has AC 10, 15 hit points, and has resistance to all damage types. If the {@spell mending|PHB} spell is cast on the caterpillar while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the caterpillar drops to 0 hit points, it can't be used again for 24 hours, at which point it regains all its hit points.

item.name: Syrinquito
entries: This mechanical insect is three inches long and has the resemblance of a mosquito. It has a pair of tiny wings that silently keep it aloft. It hovers up to 5 feet above the ground and does its best to stay at your side within your space. The syrisquito can enter and pass through another creature's space and doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

The syrisquito has a glass vial at its end that holds up to one ounce of liquid. You can use an action to command the syrisquito to ingest a potion or poison you provide, such as a potion of healing or basic poison, which is then stored in the attached vial. You can use another action to remove the glass vial from the syrisquito to retrieve its held contents or replace the vial.

The syrisquito has 10 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While the syrisquito is within your space, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word to expend 1 of its charges and cause it to fly to a creature's space within 60 feet of you and inject the target with the entirety of the contents from the vial. If there are no contents in the vial, it siphons one ounce of the creature's blood instead. If the target is unwilling, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw to avoid the syrisquito. The syrisquito then returns to your space.
If the syrisquito injects the target with something such as a potion or poison, the creature gains the effects of those contents.
If the syrisquito holds a creature's blood for at least 1 minute, it can determine and magically share with you the following properties about that creature:

items: Its creature type
Any poison or disease already affecting the creature
Any resistance or immunity to poison or disease it has

entries: The syrisquito is considered a magical object and is not a creature. It has AC 15, 20 hit points, and resistance to all damage. If the {@spell mending|PHB} spell is cast on the syrisquito while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the syrisquito drops to 0 hit points, it can‚Äôt be used again for 24 hours, at which point it regains all its hit points.

item.name: Clockwork Earwig
entries: This 1-inch-long copper mechanism magically coils around and clasps to the side of your ear, fitting as a functional ear cuff. It can be worn or removed using an action. When worn in this way, the mechanism can magically process any sound you hear, granting you the following benefits:

items: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks you make that rely on sound.

You can tap the earwig twice to record up to 1 minute of sound, tapping it twice again to stop recording early. You can tap the earwig once to replay the recording in your ear, tapping it a second time to stop it early. Pressing and holding your finger to the earwig while it's replaying the recording will pause the recording until you release your finger from it. Creating a new recording in this way erases any previous one stored.

You can speak the earwig's command word as an action to cast the {@spell comprehend languages|PHB} spell from it. The spell ends early if you remove the earwig. This property of the earwig can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries: The syrisquito is considered a magical object and is not a creature. It has AC 15, 20 hit points, and resistance to all damage. If the {@spell mending|PHB} spell is cast on the syrisquito while it has at least 1 hit point, it regains {@dice 2d6} hit points. If the syrisquito drops to 0 hit points, it can‚Äôt be used again for 24 hours, at which point it regains all its hit points.

item.name: Bands of the Found and Lost
entries: The compass-like mechanisms adorning the tops of these seemingly ordinary matching leather bracelets remain motionless until each bracelet is worn by a different creature. Once they're worn, the compass' arrows point rigidly in the direction of the matching band, without indicating height or depth. The arrows spin wildly if the bands are worn on different planes of existence.

item.name: Mercury (flask)
entries: Mercury is a liquid metal that occurs in deposits throughout the world mostyl in ore form.

Mercury usually comes in a 1-pint glass flask as it is rarely stable in any other container. Exposure to mercury can poison.  A creature that comes in contact with mercury extensively shows symptoms of poisoning such as; tremors, headaches, difficulty sleeping, impaired senses, physical weakness, breathing difficulties, and even death.
Mercury poisoning requires chelation therapy to cure.

item.name: All-In Coin
entries: On a roll you would normally use a {@dice d20}, flip a coin instead. Heads is a critical success, tails is a critical fail. It has one charge and refills when you roll 20 or 1 naturally.

item.name: Blessed Coin
entries: A bronze colored coin. Flipping the coin causes it to disappear, turning into dust. If it lands on heads, you may add 1 to any roll you take in the next 10 minutes. You may only do this to one roll. The "charge" is stored in the character for 10 minutes, similar to a bardic inspiration. You can not stack this ability on more than one roll at once, but you may hold more than one charge at once.

item.name: Hymn of Zeus
entries: A prayer book that gives +2 on Religion checks when held. Has one charge of {@spell call lightning|PHB}.

item.name: Opus of Poseidon
entries: Written by Poseidon himself. First users of the tidal magic were taught by this book. Generations have practiced these spells to carry Poseidon's will.
It needs to be soaked in saltwater regularly or the pages will dry out and fall, losing spells.
It has 8 charges and regains 1 charge on each ebb and flow cycle.

entries.caption: Spells Contained in Opus of Poseidon

item.name: Wand of Secrets
entries: While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges, and if a secret door or trap is within 30 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you. The wand regains {@dice 1d3-1} expended charges daily at dawn.

item.name: Whistle of the Meadow Genie
entries: Carved by a druid of the old ways. This whistle makes the sound of the spring winds when blown.

entries.name: Bloom
entries: Once per day, as a bonus action, you may blow this whistle to activate its magic. All flowers within 100 ft. of you bloom to life. Healing all friendly creatures within 20 ft. of you for {@dice 1d6} + your Wisdom (Nature) modifier.

item.name: Sheath of Bond
entries: The sheath magically adjusts its shape for any weapon you sheath into it.

During a long rest, you can sheath a melee weapon in it, speak its command word and bind the weapon to the sheath. As a bonus action, you can re-summon your bound weapon into the sheath, whilst the weapon is in a 30 ft. range.
There can only be one bound weapon at any time. If the bound weapon gets destroyed, the bond breaks. The bound weapon does not use your attunement slot while bound to the sheath.

item.name: Archmage Krylles‚Äô Instant Campsite
entries: Throwdown this magical pack and have a furnished 4 man tent appear, with a fire pit and roaring fire, and a pot of water on the boil.

item.name: Medallion of Silver Linings
entries: A bronze medallion with red and white strap.

You can expend any number of charges it has to increase your roll by that much. You must decide the number of charges you want to use before making the roll. It recharges 1 charge when you roll 1 on a die up to 20 charges.

item.name: Blood Pact Pendants
entries: These iron pendants come in pairs and are connected by a powerful bond of self-sacrifice. In order to create this bond, you and a friendly creature with whom you are close perform a brief, 1-minute ritual to connect your destinies and forge a blood pact. When you create this blood pact, you must each agree on a number of hit points to permanently sacrifice, reducing your total maximum hit points (minimum 1). Once a pact has been forged, trickles of the bound creatures' blood are absorbed into the normally clear gem adorning the face of this pendant. While the gem is filled in this way, it seems to gently swirl and pulse in time with your heartbeat.

While each bound creature is wearing their pendant and both are on the same plane of existence, they're protected by this pact so long as one creature is still conscious. When a bound creature dies, they're immediately revived with {@dice 2d10} hit points plus twice the number of hit points previously sacrificed by the creature. When a creature is revived in this way, the other bound creature immediately falls to 0 hit points and is knocked unconscious. This property ignores any effect that would normally prevent a creature from falling to 0 hit points. When this happens, both creatures' maximum hit points are returned to normal. Once the pact is ended in this way, the gems and pendants crack and are no longer magical.

item.name: Golden Scarab Pendant
entries: The pendants is stunning in its craftmanship, with twisting golden arcs forming the curvature of its body and head and delicately set sapphires in its eyes.

Multiple creatures can be attuned to the same pendant. Anyone attuned to the pendant is in its favor unless they do something directly destructive to nature or do something truly evil in its presence, at which time the attunement is lost.

entries.name: Lifegiver
entries: When anyone attuned to the pendant goes unconscious within 60 feet of it, the scarab unhooks itself from its chain and flies to them instantly, spreading its wings with brilliant flash of green that heals them for a number of d4s equal to the number of creatures attuned to it within 60 feet
Once this ability has been used, the beetle must spend a day under direct sunlight to recharge this ability.
When left unchecked in shadows at day time, animates and crawls towards sunlight. Then, petrifies back under sunlight.

item.name: Iuz Stone
entries: Dark crimson crystal, looks as if it is almost bleeding.
When simply held by a dread, it rejuvenates half of its missing hit points.

entries.name: Curse
entries: For each round it is held, holder is shown a different flash and it drains 1 maximum hit point permenantly.

items: First round, Graz'zt and Iggwilv together.
Second round, visual incarnation of pain and suffering.
Third round, Iuz's old human form.
Fourth round, Iuz's seven feet tall demonic form.
Fifth round, an empire of slaves.
Sixth round, a lich-god with a partially shattered eye
Seventh round, a war of empires
Eighth round, Iuz's empire's demise.
Ninth round, a city of skulls.
Tenth round, Iuz slaughtering traitors.
Eleventh round, Iuz ploting from the shadows.
Twelfth round, Iuz corrupts humanoids with hatred.

item.name: Liquid Focus
entries: You can mix and match your available spell slots. Expending a level 3 and a level 4 spell slot, you can cast a spell at level 7.

item.name: Accelerator Gem (WIP)
entries: Increases the range of your spells by 15 feet with the exception of spells with the range of touch.

item.name: Academic Focus
entries: An orb that functions as an Arcane Focus, giving -5 to Passive Perception, but proficiency (expertise if you are already proficient) on Arcana checks. You can cast {@spell legend lore|PHB} as a 4th level spell, and {@spell identify|PHB} without expending a spell slot. These spells are added to your spell list if you do not already know them, and they do not count against spells known.

item.name: Adamantine Focus
entries: It acts as a conduit between you and your target. You can expend a spell slot and lend a spell of your choosing to an ally. For the next hour, your ally can cast the spell using the spell slot as an action.

item.name: Pearl Focus
entries: Amplifies your spells. When used; the level of the spell you are casting doubles but strains your physical and spiritual form. With each use, a part of your soul is consumed. You gain 1 exhaustion and your maximum hit points are reduced by 1.

item.name: Horadric Cube (WIP)
entries: It's a hand-sized cube with engravings on it. The cube can merge the same type of magical items into greater ones.
If you touch any item to one of its sides, the item is diffused into it. You have one minute to insert the rest of the items. Otherwise, all items are ejected from it.
The time required for this process is equal to the rarity level x 10 hours. Place 5 of the same item inside the cube, lock the cube and then wait.
Some examples include: 5 +1 Longwords can be merged into a +2 Longsword within 20 hours, 5 Potions of Healing can be merged to a Potion of Greater Healing within 10 hours.

item.name: Instant Trap Tube
entries: This small cylinder seemingly has no bottom if viewed from its openings. If the owner stuffs a disassembled trap and a copper piece (it expects labor compensation for some reason) into an open end a small ball pops out from the opposite end. The traps appear as palm sized balls that can be thrown (20ft) and adhere to the surface they land on before melding almost perfectly and blending in with the environment.

item.name: Tome of Mage Guardian
entries: This book is written in elder language and belongs to an over eight thousand year lineage of Mage Guardians, magically enhanced Eldritch Knights. They have been accompanying archmages for generations. When there are no archmages to protect and serve, they are sent into hibernation. Only the aura of a powerful mage can wake them up.

The book has one purpose, passing ancestral knowledge and power of the guardians along. At least 14 Intelligence is required to understand it. Once you read this book, what you can make up of it grants you:

items: A cantrip, which you must choose from the abjuration or evocation schools
Knowledge of Weapon Bond
Ability to cast cantrips using bonus action if you used your action to attack with a two-handed melee weapon for that turn

entries: After reading, the writings will diminish for one hundred years.

item.name: Identifier Machine
entries: A contraption with a huge pearl on the right side and a hemisphere cavity on the left side. Between the two, numerous lenses and prisms are inlaid. The cavity is surfaced with polished adamantine. Whenever a magical item is brought close to the cavity, the pearl shines with the color of the specific magic school. The pearl's brightness points to the intensity of the magic.
You can expend a spell slot to infuse the machine with your magic to "{@spell identify|PHB}" the item.

item.name: Beggar's Delight
entries: Enchanted by a wizard who was sick of eating their spouse's cooking. This fork tingles in your hand when picked up.

When you use this fork to eat, you may think of any food begore taking a bite, the food on the fork takes the smell and tastes of what you are thinking of. Should the food on your fork have any poison in it, the fork magically melts in your hand.

item.name: Rat Statuette
entries: A rat statuette. The rat is posed standing up, trying to smell something.
If you lick it, roll a Performance check. On a success, you gain the ability to change your voice to someone you have heard before.

entries.name: Curse
entries: If you pay for this statuette willingly, you are cursed.
As soon as you start fiddling with it, the statuette animates and bites you.
When bitten you are affected with {@spell bane|PHB} and the rat runs away.
To get rid of the curse, you must find the rat, petrify it back to a statuette and sell it.
For the curse to transfer to another, the creature buying it must pay at least 1 copper piece for it.

item.name: Sophos's Pearl Earring
item.reqAttune: by a spellcaster with a limited number of spells known
entries: During a long rest, you can take 1 hour to read a spell to the earring. The earring will memorise it and remind you if you ever need to.
The spells doesn't count againts neither the number of spells you know bor the number of spells you can prepare.
You can cast the spell memorised by the earring once every day without expending a spell slot, if the spell is 4th-level or lower.

item.name: Earring of Whispers
entries: While attuned to this earring, you can use an action to send a telepathic message to another creature with another earring of whispers attuned similar to the {@spell sending|PHB} spell with the exceptions:

items: You can send up to ten words.
You cannot send messages across planes.
Using this item does not require visual, somatic, or material components.
Using this item requires concentration for 1 turn.

item.name: Brass Centipede
entries: When you attune to this statuette of a brass centipede, it animates and crawls into your ear. The centipede nests inside your brain, creating an extra alter ego for you to expand your mind and concentrate for you. You can concentrate on 2 spells at the same time.

entries.name: Curse
entries: You have to fend for two minds at the same time. You have -5 to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.
You need surgical tools and a surgeon to remove this centipede from your brain without killing yourself.

item.name: Companion Coin
entries: This coin creates an unbreakable magic link with a single creature when they drop a drip of blood upon it. Once linked, their name is magically inscribed on the blank side. When the coin is flipped and untouched until landing, it shows the following:

items: If it lands with the skull face up, they are dying or in a life threatening position.
If it lands with their name side face up, they're in no danger and doing okay.
If the coin lands on its edge, they are dead.

item.name: Horn of Vulgrim
entries: This is the broken horn of Vulgrim the demonic merchant. You can blow it to call him from anywhere and he will humbly answer your call.

When summoned, a glyph portal will open at the nearest square to the summoner. Any creature overlapping with the portal must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.
He also accepts souls as payment.
Vulgrim's twisted mind spins with so many detestable schemes that I doubt he even trusts himself. If this wretched demon's business is collecting souls, his pleasure is devouring them.
Always ravenous, Vulgrim will beg, steal or kill for souls. He has also been known to trade for them. A desperate warrior might find such a black bargain palatable.

item.name: Insignia of Vigilance
entries: A dark, palm sized, brass pebble with depictions of an angel with bat wings, dragging monsters into the abyss. It doubles as a {@item sending stones|DMG|sending stone}.

item.name: Skinner's Tools
entries: Each toolkit contains 3 skinning knifes with different shpaes, a whetstone, two sets of hempen rope (25 feet long), a flask of oil, and 1 lb of salt. Proficiency with these tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to skin or harvest creatures.
additionalEntries: Being used by hunters and adventurers, skinner's tools are designed for salvaging creatures. Proficiency with the tools also grants you a general knowledge of anatomy.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Thieves' tools contains 3 skinning knifes with different shpaes, a whetstone, two sets of hempen rope (25 feet long), a flask of oil, and 1 lb of salt.

additionalEntries.name: Nature and Survival.
entries: When you travel in the wild, your skill in skinning makes it easier to identify creatures and guess what kind of materials you can harvest from them.

additionalEntries.name: Investigation and Perception
entries: You gain additional insight to notice deviations and oddities of creatures.

additionalEntries.name: Handle Poison
entries: Your proficiency allows you to extract and handle a poison without risk of exposing yourself to its effects.

item.name: Mage-King's Diadem
entries: This platinum circlet can be used as a spell focus. While casting through this focus, it reduces the spell slot requirement by one, except for 1st and 9th level spells and when higher-than-default level spell slot is used for a spell.
If you are using spell points, spell point requirements are reduced accordingly.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 13}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 2d8+5}) acid damage.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 13}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 2d8+5}) acid damage.

monster.name: Nyarlathotep, The Crawling Chaos

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks

languages: is able to converse in all known languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Nyarlathotep is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). Nyarlathotep has the following warlock spells prepared:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Nyarlathotep fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Outer God
entries: Nyarlathotep does not age, nor require food, drink, or air.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Nyarlathotep can use his action to polymorph into a Small or Medium creature it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Beckoning Finger
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom modifier or be gravitated towards Nyarlathotep, using all their movement speed and action to move closer to him on their next turn.

action.name: Frightening Gaze {@recharge 5}
entries: Nyarlathotep shows his truly horrific aura to all creatures within 30 feet of him. Each creature within range must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or take 28 ({@damage 8d6}) psychic damage and become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} targets must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the target. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not {@condition frightened}.

reaction.name: Eldritch Domain
entries: When a creature moves within 20 feet of Nyarlathotep, he can force them to attempt a {@dc 24} Charisma save. On a failed save, the target's mind and body are suddenly filled with the grotesque images and sounds of eldritch horrors from beyond this earthly realm, making them roll with disadvantage on all saving throws, attack rolls, and ability checks for the next minute. Upon getting at least 60 feet away from Nyarlathotep, this effect ends on the target.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Nyarlathotep casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Beckoning Finger (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Nyarlathotep uses his Beckoning Finger.

legendary.name: Induce Madness (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Nyarlathotep focuses his fearful powers on a creature he can see within 10 feet of himself to psych them out of their own mind. The target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or be inflicted with short-term madness.

legendary.name: Ancient Theophancy (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Nyarlathotep calls upon the Great Old Ones and Outer Gods whom he serves and draws on their fearsome latent powers to crush the minds of those foolish enough to stand before him. Each creature within 40 feet of Nyarlathotep drops {@condition prone}, and must make a {@dc 24} Constitution saving throw against the great invasion on their minds, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Nyarlathotep is a devious Outer God born of Azathoth, the Lord of All Things. Nyarlathotep is a vindictive trickster who delights in suffering and causing it in beings like humans, who he finds simple and feeble-minded. He can take a variety of forms by stealing people's faces, though he also can take his original form of a tall black man. One of the things he carries always is the book of Azathoth, which he tricks people into signing. Like most of the Outer Gods, he induces nightmares and unease in people despite how charming and intelligent he appears.

immune.note: from weapon attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each enemy within 60 feet of the werewolf that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the werewolf is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the werewolf's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The werewolf has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The werewolf makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the werewolf can't bite another target.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Medium or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 8}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Goblin Totem is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The Goblin Totem has the following warlock spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Goblin warlord makes four attacks with its Spiked Chain.

action.name: Spiked Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage. The goblin warlord can force the target to make a contested Athletics check. On a failed saving throw, the target is grappled and pulled towards the goblin warlord up 5 ft.

monster.name: Tree Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Poison Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to poison damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the poison damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Necrotic Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales necrotic gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Mana Serpent
languages: understands Deep Speech but can't speak

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The mana serpent is {@condition unconscious} while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the mana serpent must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or be destroyed.

trait.name: Force Absorption
entries: Whenever the mana serpent is subjected to force damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the force damage dealt.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The mana serpent has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Drain Mana
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. If the target is a spellcaster, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence saving throw or lose one of the lowest spell slots it has available.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mana serpent's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

immune.note: (Burning Tree only)

trait.name: False Appearance (Cursed Tree only)
entries: While the cursed tree remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

trait.name: Bloodied Resistance
entries: Upon taking damage that would reduce the creature to 0 hit points or lower, the creature returns to full hit points, and the creature immediately ends all negative conditions on itself. Once this feature activates, it cannot activate again until the creature takes a long rest. This effect can occur even when taking normally lethal damage, such as from power word kill

trait.name: Tactics Change
entries: When Bloodied Resistance activates, the cursed tree becomes a rot tree, or if Bloodied Resistance is activated by fire damage it becomes a burning tree. This determines which abilities it uses.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The cursed tree deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack (Burning Tree only)
entries: The cursed tree makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage (Cursed Tree), poison damage (Rot Tree), or fire damage (Burning Tree).

legendary.name: Summon (Cursed Tree only)
entries: The cursed tree summons {@dice 1d2+1} {@creature vine blight}s.

legendary.name: Summon (Rot Tree only)
entries: The cursed tree summons {@dice 1d2+1} {@creature needle blight}s.

trait.name: Disarming Attack
entries: When Dragoslava makes an attack with her hunting knife, she can attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of her choice that it's holding. She adds the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object she choose. The object lands at its feet.

trait.name: Goading Attack
entries: When Dragoslava hits a creature with a weapon attack, she can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking her. She adds the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than her until the end of her next turn.

trait.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses Dragoslava with a melee attack, she can use her reaction and expend one superiority die to make a hunting knife attack against the creature. If she hits, she adds the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Dragoslava makes three attacks; two with her longsword and one with her hunting knife.

action.name: Hunting Knife
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

immune.note: from weapon attacks that aren't silvered

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the werewolf fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The werewolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the werewolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack (Hybrid Form Only)
entries: The werewolf makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, they must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

legendary.name: Leap
entries: The werewolf moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bark Orders
entries: The werewolf chooses a friendly creature who can see or hear it. That creature can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Frenzy (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The werewolf can make one claw attack against each creature within 5 feet of it.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The werewolf makes one attack.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

entries: If the werewolf fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The werewolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the werewolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the werewolf moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the werewolf takes 7 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

trait.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each enemy within 60 feet of the werewolf that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the werewolf is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the werewolf's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The werewolf has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Spiked Hide
entries: The werewolf has a damage threshold of 10, and any time the werewolf is targeted by a melee attack, the attacker takes {@damage 4d6} piercing damage.

trait.name: Aggressive

entries: When a creature misses the pirate hunter with a melee attack, it can use a reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

legendary.name: Fire in the hole!
entries: The pirate hunter swashbuckler throws a bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage.

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has {@condition charmed}. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Charm
entries: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Draining Kiss
entries: The fiend kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by it or a willing creature. The target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: George Cuddlebelly is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). George Cuddlebelly has the following wizard spells prepared:

monster.name: Atlantis Sentinel

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Adamantine Structure
entries: Atlantis Sentinel is made of adamantine. It can absorb and nullify magical damage. Doing so charges its core.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Atlantis Sentinel deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Pearl Core
entries: Atlantis Sentinel has an energized core which it uses as a capacitor for its Retaliating Blast. After expending a charge, Atlantis Sentinel loses its magical immunities and cannot expend another charge until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Target Lock
entries: Atlantis Sentinel must seek and aim before using its Disintegration Ray.

action.name: Disintegration Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 10d6} radiant damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust.

reaction.name: Retaliating Blast
entries: Atlantis Sentinel uses a charge in its Pearl Core to retaliate a magical attack. A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from it. Each creature in a 90-foot sphere originating from it must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from it. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed. Creatures at least 60-foot away from it make the saving throw with advantage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Volatile Cask
entries: The kobold carries a cask of flammable alcohol on its back. While it does so, the kobold can't use its hands to make attacks or use actions, and fire damage the kobold takes is also taken by the cask.

When the cask takes fire damage, roll a {@damage 1d10}. If the result is less than the fire damage dealt, the cask erupts in a 10-foot radius explosion. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Flammable objects in the area not being worn or carried ignite.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Roll Cask (1/Day)
entries: The Kobold rolls its carried cask in a straight line 15 feet in a direction of its choice. The cask then continues to roll 15 feet at the start of each of the kobold's turns, accelerating, decelerating, or changing direction with the terrain at the GM's discretion.

The cask is an object with an AC of 10 and 10 hit points (immunity to poison and psychic damage, vulnerability to fire damage), and which retains the applicable portion of the Volatile Cask trait above. If the cask collides with a creature or a solid surface, both it and what it collides with take {@damage 1d10} bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it moved this turn.

If the cask is destroyed by fire damage, the Volatile Cask trait is triggered automatically. If it is destroyed by damage of a different type, it creates a 5-foot radius pool of flammable alcohol on the ground where it was destroyed. Any fire damage dealt in the pool's area ignites it, forcing each creature in the area to succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} fire damage as the alcohol burns up.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Flammable Spirits
entries: The kobold carries many bottles filled with highly-flammable alcohol. As a bonus action on each of its turns, the kobold can stuff a rag into the opening of an alcohol bottle it is carrying and ignite it using a nearby open flame, causing its next Hurl Bottle attack to use its ignited effects.

action.name: Broken Bottle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hurl Bottle
entries: If the bottle was not ignited, the target is soaked in flammable alcohol. The next time a soaked target takes any fire damage, that fire damage is increased by {@damage 1d6} as the alcohol burns away. If not ignited, the alcohol evaporates harmlessly after 1 minute.

If the bottle was ignited, hit or miss, it shatters in a fiery explosion. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage and is ignited on a failed save, or takes half as much fire damage and is not ignited on a successful one. An ignited target takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the start of each of its turns, and can end this damage by using its action to make a {@dc 10} Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.
A flammable object in the area ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the na'arn moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a khopesh attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the na'arn can make one khopesh attack against it as a bonus action.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The na'arn has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sand Structure
entries: If the na'arn takes fire damage equal to half of its remaining hit points, it solidifies into glass.

action.name: Khopesh
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.
Na'arn are born from sand that has blood dried on it.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lava Spit {@recharge 5}
entries: Lava Drake spits out 1 foot thick molten rock-metal amalgam up to 60 feet. The lava stays hot for a minute, forcing each creature to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. Lava on the ground keeps dealing {@damage 1d8} fire damage to each creature that ends its turn within. A creature takes the same damage when it enters for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there.

monster.name: Verazin Lemmad
languages: can speak Primordial but is fluent in Ignan

trait.name: Fire Adept
entries: Any spell or effect Verazin creates ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance to fire damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Verazin  has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: Verazin senses magic within 120 feet of him at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shadow Blade
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) psychic damage, and Verazin has advantage on attack rolls against targets in dim light or darkness.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Verazin is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). Verazin has the following Sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Agressive
entries: As a bonus action, the orc can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature it can see.

trait.name: Primal Rage
entries: The orc has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws and has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.

trait.name: Crushing Build
entries: The orc deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage when she hits with a weapon attack (included in the attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The orc makes two attacks with its greatclub or its javelin.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 5} plus {@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 5} plus {@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Battle Cry (1/Day)
entries: Each creature of the orc's choice that is within 30 feet of her, can hear her, and not already affected by Battle Cry gain advantage on attack rolls until the start of the orc's next turn. The orc can then make one attack as a bonus action.

legendary.name: Command
entries: One orc within 120 feet of the orc can either move up to half its speed or make a single weapon attack.

legendary.name: Collateral Damage
entries: The orc makes an attack towards a target withing 5 feet that it had not attacked in its last turn.

legendary.name: Menacing Stance
entries: The orc makes an intimidating pose and attempts to frighten the target. The target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition frightened} of the orc until the end of the orc's next turn.

reaction.name: Enduring Disarm
entries: When the orc is hit by a melee attack, it can choose to turn it into a critical hit and use its reaction to grab the weapon from its attacker's hand on a failed contested Athletics check. The weapon is thrown 10 feet away from the orc in the direction of the orc's choice.

monster.name: Venom Queen
languages: understands Common and Elvish but can't speak them

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The venom queen can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Spider Telepathy
entries: The venom queen can magically command any spiders within 120 feet of it using telepathy.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the venom queen knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Rappel
entries: While clinging to a wall or ceiling, the venom queen can fall any distance without taking damage, landing silently on its legs.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The venom queen ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The venom queen makes two attacks with its claws, one of which can be replaced with a bite attack. It can also make a web attack, if recharged.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw.

On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d10} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}. A creature {@condition poisoned} by this attack has its movement speed halved and repeats its save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

If the poison damage from this attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Venom Spittle
entries: Each creature in a 5-foot wide, 30-foot long line must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} poison damage and is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much poison damage and is not {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Summon Brood (1/Day)
entries: The venom queen magically calls {@dice 1d4} venom crawler hatchlings and {@dice 1d4} venom crawlers. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the venom queen and obeying its telepathic commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the venom queen dies, or until the venom queen dismisses them as a bonus action.

action.name: Web {@recharge 4}
entries: The venom queen uses one of the following web effects.

action.name: Binding Web
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 14} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12; hp 15; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage). If the target is already {@condition restrained} by webbing, then until freed, it also becomes {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}, it can't make attacks, and the DC to burst the webbing increases to 16.

action.name: Snaring Strand
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 40 ft., one creature. {@h}A tough, rubbery strand of webbing attaches to the target in a straight line. While this strand is attached, the creature can't move further from the venom queen than the length of the strand, the venom queen can't use its web action on another target, and as a bonus action on each of the venom queen's turns, it can force the target to make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled up to 20 feet closer to the venom queen, simultaneously shortening the length of the attached web strand by the same distance. The web strand can be attacked and destroyed (AC 13; hp 15; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), or the venom queen can choose to detach it at any point on each of its turns (no action).

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The venom queen makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Command
entries: One spider within 120 feet of the venom queen can either move up to half its speed or make a single weapon attack.

legendary.name: Skitter (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The venom queen moves up to its speed, not provoking opportunity attacks. While doing so, it can enter the spaces of any Large or smaller creatures. The first time on a turn that the venom queen enters the space of a creature that isn't a spider, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 {@damage 2d8} piercing damage.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The spider's long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} for 10 minutes. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}. A creature {@condition poisoned} by this attack has its movement speed halved and repeats its save at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success.

If the poison damage from this attack reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Venom Spit (2/Day)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} target can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

reaction.name: Save the Queen
entries: While the spider is within 5 feet of the venom queen, whenever the venom queen would be hit by a ranged attack, the a spider can make a {@dc 14} Dexterity check. On a success, the spider becomes the target of the attack instead. In order to do so, the spider must see the attacker and the venom queen. No more than one spider can use this reaction against any single attack.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: the spider's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Large snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.

entries: The yuan-ti makes three melee attacks, but can use its bite and constrict attacks only once each.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

entries: The yuan-ti can use its action to polymorph into a Large snake, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It doesn't change form if it dies.
