entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 20/40 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) acid damage.

The target takes {@damage 3d6} poison damage an becomes {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute on a failed {@dc 13} Constitution save. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the yuan-ti can't constrict another target.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Underwater Camouflage
entries: The octopus has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made while underwater.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

action.name: Dreadful Anticipation
entries: Glasseye makes an attack every 2 turns but the anticipation and thrill are unbearable. Each creature that can see Glasseye must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 10d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the octopus can't use its tentacles on another target.

action.name: Ink Cloud (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: A 20-foot-radius cloud of ink extends all around the octopus if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute, although a significant current can disperse the ink. After releasing the ink, the octopus can use the Dash action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The crab can breathe air and water.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 10d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crab can't use its claw on another target.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The lamprey can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Slithery
entries: The lamprey has advantage on rolls made to escape {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained} conditions.

trait.name: Blood Leech
entries: The lamprey regains temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage it deals.

action.name: Latch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The halocline shrimp can only breath underwater.

trait.name: Poisonous Tendrils
entries: The halocline shrimp has poison tendrils that carry a neurotoxin. A creature that touches the shrimp or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 1d6} poison damage and is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Thunder Claw
entries: The halocline shrimp makes a claw attack and a 30-foot cone blast travels. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d8 + 5} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The halocline shrimp magically turns transparent and is considered {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The abyssal grappler can only breath underwater.

action.name: Clench
entries: The abyssal grappler clenches onto the target's face. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the abyssal grappler can't use its clench on another target. While grappled in this way, the abyssal grappler injects its acid to liquefy the target's insides and the target takes {@damage 5d6} acid damage at the start of each of its turns. Attempting to remove the abyssal grappler, agitates it to release more acid.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The dragon leviathan can only breath underwater.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@damage 10d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the dragon leviathan can't use its bite on another target.

action.name: Volcanic Rock
entries: The dragon leviathan spits lava that solidifies into a spherical rock with molten core. Upon impact it shatters. Each creature within 10 feet of impact point must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The dragon leviathan makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the sea dragon, and it takes {@damage 6d6} acid damage at the start of each of the dragon leviathan's turns.

If the dragon leviathan takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the dragon leviathan must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the dragon leviathan. If the dragon leviathan dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting prone.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The angler fish can only breath underwater.

trait.name: Bioluminescence
entries: The angler fish has an antler which bioluminescent bacteria attaches and sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the angler fish has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The drowned metamorph can breathe air and water.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 10d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 19}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crab can't use its claw on another target.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes three attacks: two with its chain and one with its hook.

action.name: Chain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the pirate can attempt to trip the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the pirate can attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of the pirate's choice that it's holding. The target must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the chosen object. The object lands at its feet.

trait.name: Nimble Action
entries: On each of its turns, the pirate can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage action.

trait.name: Weapon Juggler
entries: The pirate can draw and wield up to three onehanded weapons.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes two melee attacks or three ranged attacks with thrown weapons.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Nimble Action
entries: On each of its turns, the pirate can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage action.

trait.name: Weapon Juggler
entries: The pirate can draw and wield up to three onehanded weapons.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes two melee attacks or three ranged attacks with thrown weapons.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Hive Mind
entries: The beekeeper can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The beekeeper can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The beekeeper's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The beekeeper can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beekeeper makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Honey Bomb (1/Day)
entries: The beekeeper hurls a magical honeycomb at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. The honeycomb explodes on impact, releasing a swarm of bees. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere around corners. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} magical piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The swarm of bees remains once released and attacks any creature hostile to the fey beekeeper.

reaction.name: Scatter
entries: When the beekeeper is hit with an attack, it can momentarily transform into a scattering swarm of bees, taking only half as much damage. The beekeeper can then magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Nimble Action
entries: On each of its turns, the pirate can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage action.

trait.name: Weapon Juggler
entries: The pirate can draw and wield up to three onehanded weapons.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pirate makes two melee attacks or three ranged attacks with thrown weapons.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the bison moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra {@damage 2d10} bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

trait.name: Fear of Fire
entries: If the bison takes fire damage, it's {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The bison has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 6d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tremor
entries: The bison jumps and sends a wave of tremor in a 20-foot radius sphere. On a failed {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, creatures take {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, creatures only take half the damage.

trait.name: Feeder
entries: The leechmere regains the necrotic damage it deals as temporary hit ponits.

trait.name: Pounce
entries: If the lichmere moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hits it with a bite attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 9} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the leechmere can make one claw attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The leechmere makes four attacks. Only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d4 + 6}) piercing plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the dread can deal an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the dread that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dread fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dread makes six attacks, but can use its lunge only once.

action.name: Sun Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) radiant damage.

action.name: Lunge
entries: The dread taps into the hatred inside, releasing a crimson fog around. For the turn, the dread's speed is doubled. The dread does not provoke opportunity attacks while moving in this manner and can make an attack with sun blade as a part of this action.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses the dread with a melee attack, the dread can use a reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The dread parries one ranged or melee attack that would hit.

legendary.name: Push
entries: The dread extends his hand to release a shock wave. A target within 60 feet must make a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d10} force damage and is pushed 15 feet away from the dread in a straight line. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is pushed 5 feet.

legendary.name: Pull
entries: The dread extends his hand to drag a target within 60 feet towards the dread. The target must make a {@dc 16} Strenght saving throw. On a failed save, it is pulled 20 feet towards the dread in a straight line. On a successful save, it tis pulled 5 feet.

legendary.name: Grasp
entries: The dread attempts to grasp a creature within 60 feet and hold it captive. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} until the dread's concentration ends or until the target leaves the dread's reach.
The {@condition grappled} target can escape by succeeding on a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check.
While a target is {@condition grappled} in this manner, the dread can take an action to move the target 20 feet or crush the target for {@damage 5d10} force damage

entries: The dread throws its weapon to travel in a circular path. The weapon covers a 30-foot sphere centered on the dread. any creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a fail, creatures take {@damage 1d8+6} radiant damage. On a success, creatures take half damage.

action.name: Shadow Step
entries: The dread magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Doing so reveals its previous and current location momentarily.

action.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: The dread magically turns {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the dread wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses the dread with a melee attack, the dread can use a reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The dread parries one ranged or melee attack that would hit.

legendary.name: Push
entries: The dread extends his hand to release a shock wave. A target within 60 feet must make a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 1d10} force damage and is pushed 15 feet away from the dread in a straight line. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and is pushed 5 feet.

legendary.name: Pull
entries: The dread extends his hand to drag a target within 60 feet towards the dread. The target must make a {@dc 18} Strenght saving throw. On a failed save, it is pulled 20 feet towards the dread in a straight line. On a successful save, it tis pulled 5 feet.

legendary.name: Grasp
entries: The dread attempts to grasp a creature within 60 feet and hold it captive. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Strength saving throw or be {@condition grappled} until the dread's concentration ends or until the target leaves the dread's reach.
The {@condition grappled} target can escape by succeeding on a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check.
While a target is {@condition grappled} in this manner, the dread can take an action to move the target 20 feet or crush the target for {@damage 5d10} force damage

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the dread can deal an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the dread that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dread fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: While the dread is holding the Iuz Stone, it regains half of its missing hit points at the start of its turn. If the stone is taken from the dread, the stone turns to ash and the dread loses the hit points it recovered during the combat. The dread dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points.

trait.name: Gunslinger
entries: Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature or attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the gunslinger's ranged attack rolls with a pistol. In addition, the gunslinger ignores half cover and three-quarters cover when making ranged attacks with a pistol.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gunslinger makes two pistol attacks.

action.name: Pistol
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage.
The target is pushed 5 feet away on hit.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses the gunslinger with a melee attack, it can use a reaction to make a melee weapon attack against the creature.

legendary.name: Fire in the hole!
entries: The arcane gunslinger throws a bomb at a point up to 60 feet away. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 3d6} fire damage.

headerEntries: The dread's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The dread can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 0} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a burst of dust. Each creature within 5 feet of it must then succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mephit uses its blinding breath. It then makes a claw attack

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Blinding Breath {@recharge}
entries: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of blinding dust. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the mephit remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary shard of ice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mephit uses its mud breath. It then makes a fist attack

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Mud Breath {@recharge}
entries: The mephit belches viscid mud onto one creature within 5 feet of it. If the target is Medium or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claws

entries: The mephit exhales a 15-foot cone of scalding steam. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d4}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

headerEntries: The mephit can innately cast {@spell blur}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The nothicdra has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The nothicdra makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rotting Gaze
entries: The nothicdra targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Weird Insight
entries: The nothicdra targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the nothicdra's Wisdom (Insight) check. If the nothicdra wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

monster.name: Aquatic Vampire
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the aquatic vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Tiny quipper or a Medium cloud of sentient blood, or back into its true form.

While in quipper form, the aquatic vampire can't speak, it has a swimming speed of 40 feet. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are unchanged. Anything it is wearing transforms with it, but nothing it is carrying does. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

While in sentient blood form, the aquatic vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a swimming speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if water can pass through a space, the sentient blood can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through air. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the aquatic vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Bloody Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the aquatic vampire transforms into a cloud of sentient blood (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in sentient blood form, it can't revert to its aquatic vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its aquatic vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The aquatic vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the aquatic vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the aquatic vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The aquatic vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The aquatic vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The aquatic vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The aquatic vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the aquatic vampire's heart while the aquatic vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the aquatic vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The aquatic vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 18}).

action.name: Bite (Quipper or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the aquatic vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the aquatic vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a aquatic vampire spawn under the aquatic vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The aquatic vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the aquatic vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the aquatic vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the aquatic vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the aquatic vampire's control, it takes the aquatic vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the aquatic vampire's bite attack.

Each time the aquatic vampire or the aquatic vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the aquatic vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The aquatic vampire magically calls {@dice 2d4} swarms of {@creature swarm of quippers||quippers}, provided that the sun isn't up. While outdoors, the aquatic vampire can call {@dice 3d6} {@creature reef shark||sharks} instead. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the aquatic vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the aquatic vampire dies, or until the aquatic vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The aquatic vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: The aquatic vampire makes one unarmed strike.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The aquatic vampire makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Aquatic Vampire Spawn
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

monster.name: Rusted Iron Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Lightning Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

trait.name: Rust
entries: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the golem corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5 the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the golem is destroyed after dealing damage.

If the golem hits a creature wearing metal armor or carrying a metal shield with its Slam attack, the armor or shield (creature's choice if it has both equipped) takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The healerbee doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Recharge
entries: The healerbee has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d6+2} expended charges daily at dawn.

monster.name: Vampire Count
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 80 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 40 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balrog has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attacks have disadvantage against it.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 19}).

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 3d4} swarms of {@creature swarm of bats||bats}, provided that the sun isn't up. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The vampire makes one attack.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Shar-kali
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes three attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 17}).

action.name: Moon-Touched Hook Sword (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. The vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 17}).

action.name: Nightshade Dagger (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 2d4} swarms of {@creature swarm of bats||bats}, provided that the sun isn't up. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 16}).

action.name: Psychic Blades
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) psychic damage.

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

action.name: Children of the Night (1/Day)
entries: The vampire magically calls {@dice 1d4} swarms of {@creature swarm of bats||bats}, provided that the sun isn't up. The called creatures arrive in {@dice 1d4} rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The vampire makes one attack.

legendary.name: Bite (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack.

monster.name: Shivynara
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Spell Sniper
entries: When the vampire cast a spell that requires an attack roll, the spell's range is doubled.
The vampire ignores half cover and three-quarters cover.

trait.name: Sculpt Spells
entries: The vampire can spare up to 3 creatures from its area of effect spells.

trait.name: Potent Cantrip
entries: When a creature succeeds on a saving throw against the vampire's cantrip, the creature takes half the cantrip's damage (if any) but suffers no additional effect from the cantrip.

trait.name: Empowered Evocation
entries: The vampire adds its Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of any evocation spell it cast.

entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by its nature, rather by the accord among vampires.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart.} If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire's heart while the vampire is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place, the vampire is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack (Vampire Form Only)
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Unarmed Strike (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 15}).

action.name: Greatsword (Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain in this way and then buried in the ground rises the following night as a {@creature vampire spawn} under the vampire's control.

action.name: Charm
entries: The vampire targets one humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. If the target can see the vampire, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw against this magic or be {@condition charmed} by the vampire. The {@condition charmed} target regards the vampire as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the vampire's control, it takes the vampire's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can, and it is a willing target for the vampire's bite attack.

Each time the vampire or the vampire's companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the vampire is destroyed, is on a different plane of existence than the target, or takes a bonus action to end the effect.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The vampire makes one attack.

monster.name: Mir Enbee
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: If the vampire isn't in sunlight or running water, it can use its action to polymorph into a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form.

While in mist form, the vampire can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can't pass through water. It has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Misty Escape
entries: When it drops to 0 hit points outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that it isn't in sunlight or running water. If it can't transform, it is destroyed.

While it has 0 hit points in mist form, it can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then {@condition paralyzed} until it regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 hit points, it regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Wailing Aura
entries: The vampire's hunger and agony echoes louder away from it.

At the start of each of the vampire's turns, each creature of the vampire's choice that is not within 5 feet of it (up to 300 feet) takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to being {@condition frightened}from the vampire for the next 24 hours

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the vampire dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the balrog's weapons.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The vampire makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, that creature takes the bite's damage and is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the vampire, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the vampire's turns.

If the vampire takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of it. If the vampire dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

entries: At the start of each of the balrog's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the balrog or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The balrog has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The balrog's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The balrog makes two attacks: one with its longsword and one with its whip.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage. If the balrog scores a critical hit, every creature within 30 feet takes {@damage 3d8} lightning damage.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 25 feet toward the balrog.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The balrog magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The zombie has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The zombie makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The fire minimental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the minimental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1 fire damage. In addition, the minimental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space in a turn, that creature takes 1 fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 1 fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The minimental sheds bright light in a 15 foot radius and dim light an additional 15 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the minimental moves in water it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Touch
entries: Melee Weapon attack: {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} fire damage. If the target is a creature or flammable object it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 1 fire damage at the start of each of its turns

Fire minimentals have an innate desire to embrace  creatures and inanimate objects. Typically  encountered by themselves, they tend to be lonely  and will actively seek out contact. Due to their  flaming body, fire minimentals are the only minimental  that actively pose a constant threat to those around them, through no intent of their own. They are known to accidentally start fires by embracing flammable objects and living creatures. They have sometimes been sighted clinging to the limbs of creatures that are immune to fire, giving the creature the appearance of being engulfed in flames. Once fire minimentals find each other, they generally avoid parting, and sufficient numbers will act akin to a roaming fire.

trait.name: Water Breathing
entries: The Water Minimental can breathe underwater.

trait.name: Water Form
entries: The Water Minimental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Slam
entries: Melee Weapon attack: {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} bludgeoning damage.

Water minimentals tend to be social and stay in groups, often taking up refuge in water sources where they are invisible unless disturbed. They generally despise temperature extremes, and will shy away from flame or cold. If a number of water minimentals gather in a town‚Äôs well or potable water source, they form invisible barriers that make it difficult to access the water underneath. Due to this trait, they can be a nuisance to towns that find themselves with an infestation. Water minimentals prefer to go with the flow, and tend to flow down towards sea level, as water is apt to do. It is unknown how many of these minimentals exist in the oceans of the material plane.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The Air minimental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} bludgeoning damage.

Air minimentals are naturally moody but curious, plagued with a short attention span. These minimentals are most often observed in the form of small cloud formations of varying colour, which tend to change with their mood. They are light enough to fly, but risk getting carried away by gusts of wind if they stray too far from the ground, tending to stick to the gentler currents close to the earth. Due to their erratically nomadic nature, they are most often encountered alone. When upset, or even when simply sneezing, they can accidentally discharge a static shock. An individual air minimental‚Äôs shocks are not much of a threat, but large, grumpy groups of them can generate surprisingly intense thunderstorms that may pose a threat to less structurally sound buildings.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The Earth Minimental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone.
While doing so, the Earth Minimental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} bludgeoning damage.

Earth minimentals are drawn towards movement of any kind. It will follow creatures for hours until it loses sight of them, just to observe what they do. Earth Minimentals are stubborn but fun loving, and when they have nothing to follow they will climb hills and mountains to roll down for their amusement. They are social by nature, and will happily form squads of other earth minimentals to travel with, though often break apart due to members tripping and rolling away from their kin. Large groups of them can create dangerous terrain, especially when rolling down slopes. Earth minimentals who have been on the material plane may go through a change similar to adolescence in humans, and small precious gems can grow on their face.

trait.name: Smoke Form
entries: The Smoke minimental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. If the hostile creature is size Small or smaller, it is {@condition blinded} while the minimental is in its space.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} bludgeoning damage.

Always following in the shadow of fire minimentals, smoke minimentals tend to be a little awkward around creatures and people. Despite this, it desires nothing more than to cling to people, engulfing them in its distinctive smell. Smoke minimentals love to hang out around fires, both while they're burning and after they're put out. They can often be hard to see, blending into the charred remains of buildings and forests with ease. Given their composition, they are able to flow under doors or through tiny openings, but they are easily dispersed by stronger winds.

trait.name: Dust Body
entries: The Dust minimental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. If the creature has a nose, it must make a {@dc 8} CON save, sneezing on a fail.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} bludgeoning damage.

Nestled in quiet, forgotten corners of abandoned buildings and caves live the dust minimentals. They tend to be very wary of creatures, mostly keeping to themselves, and are usually shy if approached. Dust minimentals are sleepy and quite content to doze the day away with others of their kind in the quiet darkness, away from loud noises and wind. Once they find a suitable corner or neglected shelf, they rarely move unless disturbed. They are able to contort their body to fil natural crevices and escape predators through tiny openings.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the minimental remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a natural ice formation.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Drop
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, one creature directly underneath the minimental. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage per 10 feet fallen, up to 6 ({@dice 3d4}).
Miss: The minimental takes half the normal falling damage for the distance fallen.

In deep snow and frozen caves, ice minimentals make their homes. Some groups burrow underneath the snow, forming large and complex tunnel systems that travelers have found themselves falling into when traversing snowfields. Others prefer to cling to cave ceilings, and groups of them are often mistaken for natural ice stalactites. These hanging ice minimentals are particularly dangerous, as they can drop from the ceiling onto unaware explorers. Ice minimentals strictly stick to cold places and do everything they can to avoid fire.

trait.name: Magma Body
entries: A creature that touches the minimental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it take 1 fire damage.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The minimental sheds bright light in a 15 foot radius and dim light an additional 15 feet.

action.name: Bump
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d4 - 1} bludgeoning damage.

Magma minimentals are typically found around active volcanoes, but a select few have been spotted far away from their usual fiery nests. These minimentals are grumpy and easily angered, prompting them to eject molten lava from their backs. Their bodies are very hot to the touch, and use this to their advantage when bumping into hostile creatures. As long as they are left alone, magma minimentals are generally not threatening. The light from their magma chamber makes them easily spottable from a distance, especially at night.

trait.name: Camouflage
entries: The moss kitten has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in terrain made of plants.

action.name: Ensnaring Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 {@damage 1d4 + 3} slashing damage. If the target is a creature the moss kitten can cause vines to grow from the wound reducing the creatures speed by 10 feet for one minute or until it receives magical healing.

action.name: Verdant Blessing
entries: As an action, the moss kitten can touch another creature to give it a random minor boon of its choice from the options below until the creature finishes a long rest or the moss kitten is reduced to 0 hit points.

items: Feywild Feet: The creature's speed increases by 5 feet.
Forest's Shroud: The creature's AC increased by 1.
Wild Strength: The creature gains {@dice 1d4} temporary hit points and adds  {@dice 1d4} to Strength checks.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: moss kitten's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

entries: Playful and mischievous, moss kittens are small fey which resemble house cats. But their fur is covered in a soft, green moss. They can often be found lounging in the branches of dryads' trees, soaking up the sun's rays. Moss kittens eat fruits and nuts. However, they appear to eat much less than the house cats, suggesting they absorb energy from sunlight in a similar manner to plants. As they age, green stems grow from underneath their fur and bloom into a rainbow of different flowers.

Symbiotic Tree Dwellers. Moss Kittens use fey magic to strengthen their home trees. In return, the trees provide shelter, safe perches, and food. You can often tell when a tree is home to a nest of kittens by looking for blooms and fruits out of season. Dryads, pixies, and other woodland fey often encourage moss kittens to live in or near their homes.

entries.caption: Plot Hooks
rows: A nest of moss kittens has taken up residence in the village's sacred tree and are causing all kinds of mischief throughout the town. The party is hired to remove them.
A dryad's nest of moss kittens was taken by poachers and she asks the characters to save them.
Goblins have captured a family of pixies and a moss 3 kitten tries desperately to get the characters' attention so they can help the kitten save her friends.
Goblins have captured a family of pixies and a moss 3 kitten tries desperately to get the characters' attention so they can help the kitten save her friends.

trait.name: Apprentice Wandslinging
entries: Wandslinger is a broad term for any wizard who trains to use a wand in the manner of a martial application. This training grants them profound mastery over a few devastating effects, precision and potency with their wands, and the ability to wield and even recharge them. Instead of relying on cantrips, wandslingers can channel raw magic through their wands.

Wandslingers do not require verbal or material components when casting through their wands. A swing of their wand is enough to channel magical power through it quickly. A wandslinger can cast their known cantrips as a bonus action.
Wandslingers are known to perform powerful trick shots to disable or damage their opponents using their wand.
Apprentice wandslingers create 3 missiles.

action.name: Wand Strike
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d4+1}) force damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wandslinger is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 11}, {@hit 3} to hit with spell attacks). The wandslinger has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Wandslinging
entries: Wandslinger is a broad term for any wizard who trains to use a wand in the manner of a martial application. This training grants them profound mastery over a few devastating effects, precision and potency with their wands, and the ability to wield and even recharge them. Instead of relying on cantrips, wandslingers can channel raw magic through their wands.

Wandslingers do not require verbal or material components when casting through their wands. A swing of their wand is enough to channel magical power through it quickly. A wandslinger can cast their known cantrips as a bonus action.
Wandslingers are known to perform powerful trick shots to disable or damage their opponents using their wand.
Wandslingers create 3 missiles and have access to trick shots.

items.name: Confusing Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can attempt to discombobulate the creature. On a hit, the creature must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or become unable to cast spells or use magical items until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Disarming Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can attempt to shoot an object from its hands. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or drop 1 held object of the wandslinger's choice and have that object be pushed 10 feet away from the wandslinger.

items.name: Distracting Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can distract the creature, giving its allies an opening. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or the next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than the wandslinger has advantage if the attack is made before the start of the wandslinger's next turn.

items.name: Forceful Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can attempt to trip them up and force them back. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 5 feet away from the wandslinger.

items.name: Winging Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can attempt to topple a moving target. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Wand Strike
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4+2}) force damage.

Instead of relying on cantrips, wandslingers can channel raw magic through their wands.

Wandslingers do not require verbal or material components when casting through their wands. A swing of their wand is enough to channel magical power through it quickly. A wandslinger can cast their known cantrips as a bonus action.

Master wandslingers create 5 missiles and have access to trick shots.

items.name: Disarming Shot

On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw or drop 1 held object of the wandslinger's choice and have that object be pushed 10 feet away from the wandslinger.

entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can distract the creature, giving its allies an opening. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or the next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than the wandslinger has advantage if the attack is made before the start of the wandslinger's next turn.

items.name: Hindering Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can attempt to hinder the target. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw or have its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn.

items.name: Menacing Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can attempt to threaten the target, potentially forcing them into a defensive state. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Charisma saving throw or become incapacitated until the end of its next turn. While incapacitated in this way, the creature has half cover.

items.name: Winging Shot
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can attempt to topple a moving target. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

items.name: Split Fire
entries: When the wandslinger makes a wand attack against a creature, the wandslinger can make another attack against another creature within range.
