entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4+4}) force damage.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the secluded's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The secluded has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Shadow Weapons
entries: The Secluded's weapon attacks are magical. When the secluded hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} poison damage (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The secluded makes a 3 war scythe attacks in one action.

action.name: War Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage.
Special. This weapon has the heavy property and requires Strength of 19 to use as a one-handed weapon.

trait.name: Evasive Diver
entries: While in areas of sand (not packed earth or stone), if the thunderherder makes a successful Dexterity saving throw that normally deals half damage on a successful saving throw, the thunderherder instead manages to instantly dive below the protective sand or earth and takes no damage.
When the thunderherder dives below the sand. If the rider fails a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, it is swept from the thunderherder's back.

trait.name: Exotic Mount
entries: These creatures can be domesticated and trained to become mounts. The poison stingers of most domesticated ashworms are clipped.

A tamed thunderherder is suitable as a mount for a Medium humanoid. However, the rider must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom (Animal Handling) check once every 24 hours if in a sandy environment or be swept off the back of the thunderherder as it dives below the surface for {@dice 1d4} rounds before returning to its rider. A thunderherder is hard to control in combat.
A thunderherder mount requires an exotic saddle, benefits from stabling, can wear custom barding (specially constructed, adding an additional 50% to the price), and requires feed like a normal mount.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or , taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

On average, the body of a thunderherder grows to be 3 to 5 feet (0.91 to 1.5 meters) wide and 5 to 10 feet (1.5 to 3 meters) in length. Their bodies are covered in a thin layer of chitinous, pale purple plates. On one end of their body is a large stinger.
Unlike their cousin, the purple worm, thunderherders are relatively non-aggressive creatures.
Thunderherders secret a substance from their bodies that allow them to stick to vertical surfaces. Their large stinger is poisonous.

trait.name: Divine Strike
entries: The dragon knight's melee weapon attacks are magical. When the dragon knight hits with any melee weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Blessed Restoration
entries: The dragon knight channels its faith to recover hit points. The dragon knight can regain 45 hit points using an action. Once used it cannot use this feature again before taking a long rest.

trait.name: Draconic Immunity
entries: The dragon knight is immune to damage from its draconic type.

trait.name: Draconic Shield
entries: The dragon knight adds its Charisma modifier to the saving throws (included in the saving throws).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon knight makes either two longsword attacks or uses its draconic breath.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Draconic Breath {@recharge 4}
entries: The dragon knight exhales destructive energy. Its damage is determined by the draconic type, as shown in the table.

When the dragon knight uses its draconic breath, each creature in the area of the exhalation must make a {@dc 15} saving throw, the type of which is determined by its draconic type. A creature takes 26 ({@damage 4d12}) damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

When the spellsnare fighter damages a creature that is concentrating on a spell, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw it makes to maintain its concentration.

Additionally, the spellsnare fighter can keep concentrating on a spell while under the effect of a {@item spell jammer|canbrew}, if it succeeds on a concentration check at the start of its turn.

monster.name: Sophos
languages: is able to converse in all known languages

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: Sophos has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Sophos fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Fluid Magic
entries: Sophos can use {@5etools spell points|https://5e.tools/variantrules.html#spell points_dmg} instead of spell slots.

trait.name: Reactive Eye
entries: Sophos does not need to expend its reaction to cast {@spell counterspell|PHB}.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Damage Redirection
entries: When the tiefling slashtail is hit by a melee attack, it can use its reaction to take only half damage dealt to it (rounded down) and a creature of the tiefling slashtail's choice that is within 5 ft. takes the rest of the damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Sophos is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). Sophos has all the wizard spells prepared but it favors the following:

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: Sophos casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Dispell
entries: Sophos casts {@spell dispell magic|PHB}.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: Sophos uses its centeral eye to detect magical effects and items within its sight.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Sophos beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of Sophos must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Sophos can then fly up to half its flying speed.

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Death Burst
entries: When the mephit dies, it explodes in a cloud of steam. Each creature within 5 feet of the mephit must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mephit uses its steam breath. It then makes a claw attack

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d10+1}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (1/Day)
headerEntries: The mephit can innately cast {@spell blur}, requiring no material components. Its innate spellcasting ability is Charisma.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The storm naga can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Cold Susceptibility
entries: If the storm naga takes cold damage, it suffers two effects until the end of its next turn: its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

trait.name: Magical Resistance
entries: The naga has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it dies, the naga returns to life in {@dice 1d6} days and regains all its hit points. Only a {@spell wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6+3}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Electric Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage, and the target can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The storm naga's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

from: {@item half plate armor of fire resistance|DMG}

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The elf has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the elf to sleep.

trait.name: Flaming Conjuration
entries: The flashblade legionnaire can conjure two flaming battleaxes as a bonus action. It must concentrate as if concentrating on a spell. If the flashblade legionnaire lets go of the battleaxe, it disappears. Each flaming battle axe sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flashblade legionnaire makes three attacks with its flame battleaxes or one attack with its blowgun.

action.name: Flame Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8+3}) fire damage.

action.name: Tranquiling Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 25/100 ft., one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage. On a hit, the target must make a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or be put to sleep for 1 hour. A creature can use its action to wake the target up.

legendaryGroup.name: Werewolf Chieftain
lairActions: While the werewolf is in its lair, it can take lair actions as long as it isn't incapacitated.
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the werewolf can take one of the following lair action options, or forgo using any of them in that round:

items: Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the werewolf doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
The werewolf can extinguish all nonmagical lights in the area and any magical light has its dim and bright radii halved.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a werewolf's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

items: There's a noticeable increase in the populations of wolves in the region.
Moonlight cast within 500 feet of the lair seem abnormally intense and sometimes moon rays are visible.

regionalEffects: If the werewolf is destroyed, these effects end after {@dice 2d6} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Werewolf Leader
lairActions: While the werewolf is in its lair, it can take lair actions as long as it isn't incapacitated.
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the werewolf can take one of the following lair action options, or forgo using any of them in that round:

items: Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the werewolf doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a werewolf's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

items: There's a noticeable increase in the populations of wolves in the region.

regionalEffects: If the werewolf is destroyed, these effects end after {@dice 2d6} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Werewolf Predator
regionalEffects: The region surrounding a werewolf's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

items: There's a noticeable increase in the populations of wolves in the region.

regionalEffects: If the werewolf is destroyed, these effects end after {@dice 2d6} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Vampire Count
lairActions: While the vampire is in its lair, it can take lair actions as long as it isn't incapacitated.
On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the vampire can take one of the following lair action options, or forgo using any of them in that round:

items: Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the vampire can pass through solid walls, doors, ceilings, and floors as if they weren't there.

The vampire targets any number of doors and windows that he can see, causing each one to either open or close as he wishes. Closed doors can be magically locked (needing a successful {@dc 20} Strength check to force open) until the vampire chooses to end the effect, or until the vampire uses this lair action again.

The vampire summons the angry spirit of one who has died in the lair. The apparition appears next to a hostile creature that the vampire can see, makes an attack against that creature, and then disappears. The apparition has the statistics of a specter.

The vampire targets one Medium or smaller creature that casts a shadow. The target's shadow must be visible to the vampire and within 30 feet of him. If the target fails a {@dc 21} Charisma saving throw, its shadow detaches from it and becomes a shadow that obeys the vampire's commands, acting on initiative count 20. A greater restoration spell or a remove curse spell cast on the target restores its natural shadow, but only if its undead shadow has been destroyed.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a vampire's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

items: There's a noticeable increase in the populations of bats in the region.
Plants within 500 feet of the lair wither, and their stems and branches become twisted and thorny.
Shadows cast within 500 feet of the lair seem abnormally gaunt and sometimes move as though alive.
A creeping fog clings to the ground within 500 feet of the vampire's lair. The fog occasionally takes eerie forms, such as grasping claws and writhing serpents.

regionalEffects: If the vampire is destroyed, these effects end after {@dice 2d6} days.

lairActions: While the vampire is in its lair, it can take lair actions as long as it isn't incapacitated.

If the target fails a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw, its shadow detaches from it and becomes a shadow that obeys the vampire's commands, acting on initiative count 20. A greater restoration spell or a remove curse spell cast on the target restores its natural shadow, but only if its undead shadow has been destroyed.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a vampire's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

regionalEffects: If the vampire is destroyed, these effects end after {@dice 2d6} days.

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the vampire can take one of the following lair action options, or forgo using any of them in that round:

items: Until initiative count 20 of the next round, the vampire can pass through solid walls, doors, ceilings, and floors as if they weren't there.

regionalEffects: The region surrounding a vampire's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

items: There's a noticeable increase in the populations of bats in the region.

regionalEffects: If the vampire is destroyed, these effects end after {@dice 2d6} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Vampire Sir
regionalEffects: The region surrounding a vampire's lair is warped by the creature's unnatural presence, creating any of the following effects:

items: There's a noticeable increase in the populations of bats in the region.

regionalEffects: If the vampire is destroyed, these effects end after {@dice 2d6} days.

legendaryGroup.name: Aquatic Vampire
lairActions: On Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the orc can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects: it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@dice 1d2} orcs come rushing to aid the orc from up to 60 feet close to the orc.

regionalEffects: The region containing the aquatic vampire's lair is warped by its magic, creating one or more of the following effects:

items: There's a noticeable increase in the population of quippers and reef sharks in the region. Aquatic plants within 500 feet of the lair become black and tangled and sometimes look like outstretched claws.
The surfaces of water within 500 feet of the lair reflect perversions of the original image, making living creatures seem gaunt or undead.

A creeping fog clings to the surface of the water within 500 feet of the vampire's lair. The fog occasionally takes eerie forms, such as grasping claws and writhing serpents. The entirety of the vampire's lair is considered desecrated.
All undead creatures in the aquatic vampire's lair have advantage on saving throws.

regionalEffects: If the aquatic vampire is destroyed, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Orc War Baron
lairActions: On Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the orc can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects: it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: {@dice 1d2} orcs come rushing to aid the orc from up to 60 feet close to the orc.

regionalEffects: The region containing the orc war baron's lair is warped by its magic, creating one or more of the following effects:

items: A regional effect

regionalEffects: If the orc war baron is destroyed, these effects fade over the course of 1d10 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Storm Naga
lairActions: A storm naga encountered in its lair has a challenge rating of 10 (5,900 XP). On Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the naga can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects: it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

items: The storm naga instantly inscribes a glyph (as if by the {@spell glyph of warding|PHB} spell) on the surface of an unoccupied 10-foot-squared area within its lair. If the glyph is a spell glyph, it consumes one use of the spell from the storm naga‚Äôs Spellcasting. If the glyph is an explosive rune, it deals 13 ({@damage 3d8}) lightning damage.
The storm naga calls forth three guards that appear from the entrance nearest to the storm naga. The guards flee if the storm naga dies.

A thin blue streak of lightning springs from the storm naga‚Äôs pointing finger to a creature the storm naga can see within 60 feet of it. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. If the save fails by 5 or more, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of its next turn instead.

entries.name: Age
entries: Vampires don't mature and age in the same way that other races do.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Vampires might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but many of them end up there. Evil or not, their strict hierarchies incline them toward a lawful alignment.

entries.name: Size
entries: Vampires are the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Bloodthirst
entries: You can use an action to drain blood and life energy from a willing creature, or one that is {@condition grappled} by you, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. Make a melee attack against the target. If you hit, you deal 1 piercing damage and {@dice 1d6} necrotic damage. If you make consecutive attacks to drink blood, you only deal the necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and you regain hit points equal to that amount from humanoids and half from other creatures. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
A humanoid killed in this way becomes a null. You cannot drain blood from constructs, elementals, oozes, plants, and undead creatures.

entries.name: Vampire Lord
entries: You can feed your blood to a willing creature, or one that is {@condition grappled} by you, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. Make a Strength (Athletics) check contested by the target‚Äôs Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, the target is tainted with your blood and turns into a {@creature vampire spawn} after a long rest. Whether you succeed or fail, you lose {@dice 5d20} hit points. If you drop to 0 hit points during this process, it fails.

A {@creature vampire spawn} created in this way is automatically charmed by you. Each time you or one of your companions do anything harmful to the target, it can make a Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. DC for this saving throw is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus added twice. Otherwise, the effect lasts until it grows into a full vampire or until you are destroyed. The DC is reduced by 2 for each vampire spawn you already have under your charm.
Beware of a spawn's hunger, as it may consume its maker.

entries.name: Feast of Blood
entries: When you drain blood with your Bloodthirst ability, you experience a surge of vitality. Your speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks and saving throws for 1 minute. If you, consecutively, drink enough blood to fill half your maximum hit points, you lose a level of exhaustion.

entries.name: Claws
entries: As a bonus action, you can extend or retract one or two of your claws. You are considered holding a weapon with a hand that has extended claws.
Your claws are natural melee weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal {@damage 1d4} slashing. These weapons have finesse and light properties.

entries.name: Vampiric Resistance
entries: You have resistance to necrotic damage and bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

entries.name: Rejuvenation
entries: You can take a minute and gain an exhaustion level to acquire one benefit from either Lesser Restoration or Greater Restoration spells. You cannot reduce your exhaustion by using this trait. If you are not starving, you can regrow 1 limb during a long rest.

entries.name: Sustained Metabolism
entries: You can hold your breath for 1 hour plus 15 minutes for each constitution modifier points you have. You can expend a point from your blood pool to decrease your hunger for food for a day.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: You have the following flaws:

items.name: Forbiddance
entries: You can't enter a private residence without an invitation from one of the occupants. This flaw isn‚Äôt caused by your nature, rather by the accord among vampires.

items.name: Harmed by Running Water
entries: You take 20 acid damage if you end your turn in running water.

items.name: Stake to the Heart
entries: If a stake is driven into your heart, you are {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.

items.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
entries: You take 20 radiant damage when you start your turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

items.name: Cleansing Light
entries: You have vulnerability to radiant damage.

items.name: Starving
entries: You have a blood pool of 10 of which you lose 1 every day. If it drops to 5, you have 1 extra level of exhaustion. If it drops to 3, you have 2 extra levels of exhaustion. If it drops to 1, you have 3 extra levels of exhaustion. At 5 points or below, you are considered starving. Each time you deal necrotic damage to a creature by drinking its blood, you regain one point of your blood pool.

entries.name: Heightened Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception} skill.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and two extra languages of your choice.

race.name: Klyntar (Void)
entries: Klyntar have the following racial traits:

entries.name: Age
entries: Klyntar do not age. They leap from a host to another and can live for tens of thousands of years

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Each Klyntar has a different purpose like; world domination, species invasion, freeing Klyntar from Knull's dominion, or saving a race from total extinction. They range from lawful evil to chaotic good.

entries.name: Size
entries: a Klyntar's size is dependent on their host. Your size is medium.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: Accustomed to the lack of light in empty space, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Unique Physiology
entries: You are unable to gain temporary hit points no matter what and healing effects on you are halved. You have double the maximum hit dice you normally have to roll to gain Hit Points. If you haven't used your movement for the turn, as an action, you can expend a hit die to recover hit points. After doing so, your speed is zero.

entries.name: Unchained Evolution
entries: Your ability score maximums are increased by 2.

entries.name: Hybrid Nature
entries: You have two creature types: humanoid and aberration. You can be affected by a game effect if it works on either of your creature types.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Abyssal.

entries.name: Parasitic Awareness
entries: Creatures don't gain advantage while flanking you. You have two reactions instead of one.

entries.name: Vibration Sensitivity
entries: You have vulnerability to thunder and force damage.

entries.name: Infused Structure
entries: Your pseudopods are natural melee weapons, with which you're proficient. If you hit with a pseudopod, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier.

entries.name: Augmented Muscles
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} skill.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift

entries.name: Impervious Vitaliy
entries: When you roll a hit die to gain Hit Points, you instead take the maximum of it.

Though we are a benevolent species, there is no literature on my home planet. And though it is our goal to make the universe better, we create no art, no music, no culture. At least, not as other civilizations would understand it. All we have are our hosts -- the beings we join with -- to forge through the cold and unforgiving cosmos with. The bond between a Klyntar and its host is sacred. They give our lives context and our existence meaning. They give us history. All we have are our hosts to tell us who we are.

Klyntar are a species of inorganic, amorphous, symbiotic extraterrestrials created from the "living abyss" at the beginning of the universe by the primordial deity Knull, who manifested a sword of living darkness called All-Black from his shadow to slaughter the Celestials and other deities.

entries.name: True Form
entries: You are a black goo and you can shapeshift yourself to mimic medium objects. When attached to a host, you can make yourself look like common clothes at will while you're out of combat. In combat, you refer to yourself in a plural manner.

entries.name: Klyntar Names
entries: Most Klyntars have unpronounceable names. So, they take nicknames instead.

entries.name: Nicknames
entries: Spasm, Hook, Rash, Ghost, Limit, Coil, Fang, Mold, Deceit, Rot, Pulse, Havoc, Shade, Fume, Torment, Whip, Judgement, Sidestep, Spark, Phase, Feedback, Blight, Twitch, Quicksand, Regret, Sooth, Spite, Fang, Flex, Aftermath, Fallout, Inferno, Fume, Midnight.

entries.name: Sharpened Ferocity

entries.name: Feral Motion
entries: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

entries.name: Enhanced Metabolism
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Acrobatics} skill.

entries.name: Vertical Motion
entries: You have a climbing speed of 20 feet as long as you are not encumbered or wearing heavy armor.

entries.name: Piercing Thought
entries: You know the {@spell mind sliver|TCE} cantrip. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

entries.name: Stout Mind
entries: You have resistance to psychic damage.

Though we are a benevolent species, there is no literature on my home planet. And though it is our goal to make the universe better, we create no art, no music, no culture. At least, not as other civilizations would understand it. All we have are our hosts -- the beings we join with -- to forge through the cold and unforgiving cosmos with. The bond between a Klyntar and its host is sacred. They give our lives context and our existence meaning. They give us history. All we have are our hosts to tell us who we are.

Klyntar are a species of inorganic, amorphous, symbiotic extraterrestrials created from the "living abyss" at the beginning of the universe by the primordial deity Knull, who manifested a sword of living darkness called All-Black from his shadow to slaughter the Celestials and other deities.

entries.name: True Form
entries: You are a black goo and you can shapeshift yourself to mimic medium objects. When attached to a host, you can make yourself look like common clothes at will while you're out of combat. In combat, you refer to yourself in a plural manner.

entries.name: Klyntar Names
entries: Most Klyntars have unpronounceable names. So, they take nicknames instead.

entries.name: Nicknames
entries: Spasm, Hook, Rash, Ghost, Limit, Coil, Fang, Mold, Deceit, Rot, Pulse, Havoc, Shade, Fume, Torment, Whip, Judgement, Sidestep, Spark, Phase, Feedback, Blight, Twitch, Quicksand, Regret, Sooth, Spite, Fang, Flex, Aftermath, Fallout, Inferno, Fume, Midnight.

spell.name: Permanency

m.text: 5000 gp per level of the spell being made permanent, which the spell consumes

entries: Choose a spell and appropriate target(s) from the list below. You must also already know the spell and/or have it prepared in order to choose it. You cas that spell and make it permanent as part of casting permanency, expending spell slots for both. The chosen spell lasts until dispelled (see below) instead of for its normal duration. If a spell would end for a reason other than its duration expiring (such as those listed for {@spell invisibility|PHB} spell) then spell ends as normal.

You must be of a certain level in your spellcasting class to make certain spells permanent. The minimum spellcaster level to make a spell permanent is equal to 8 + the spell's elvel. For example, you must be at least an 11th-level spellcaster to make the {@spell tongues|PHB} spell permanent.
Different spells have different allowable targets, either yourself, another willing creature, an object, an area, or some combination of those. Allowable targets for each spell are shown below

If the target affected by the permanent spell is targeted with a successful {@spell dispel magic|PHB} spell, the effect is suppressed for 24 hours, rather than being permanently dispelled. If the effect is dispelled every day 30 days, it is permanently dispelled. An affected target entering an {@spell antimagic field|PHB} has the ability suppressed as if it were one originating from a magic item.

entries.name: Self Only
items: {@spell comprehend languages|PHB}, {@spell detect magic|PHB}, {@spell expeditious retreat|PHB}, {@spell alter self|PHB}, {@spell see invisibility|PHB}, {@spell fly|PHB}, {@spell tongues|PHB}, {@spell true seeing|PHB}

entries.name: Self or Other
items: {@spell barkskin|PHB}, {@spell darkvision|PHB}, {@spell enlarge/reduce|PHB}, {@spell spider climb|PHB}, {@spell stoneskin|PHB}, {@spell rary's telepathic bond|PHB}

entries.name: Self, Other, or Object
items: {@spell invisibility|PHB}, {@spell nondetection|PHB}

entries.name: Object Only
items: {@spell illusory script|PHB}, {@spell magic weapon|PHB}, {@spell elemental weapon|PHB}, {@spell animate objects|PHB}

entries.name: Area
items: {@spell alarm|PHB}, {@spell fog cloud|PHB}, {@spell web|PHB}, {@spell stinking cloud|PHB}, {@spell wall of fire|PHB}, {@spell wall of force|PHB}, {@spell wall of stone|PHB}, {@spell arcane gate|PHB}, {@spell wall of thorns|PHB}, {@spell reverse gravity|PHB}, {@spell antimagic field|PHB}, {@spell prismatic wall|PHB}

spell.name: Yalen's Yester Yank

m.text: A seal emblazoned with tiny gems worth 3500 gp in total.

entries: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell and mark it with the seal. The object must be no larger than a 1-foot cube and it must have a minimum of 3-inch diameter flat surface on which the seal can leave its mark. The seal glows with feint yellow light.
Once For 24 hours, you can summon the object magically back to you as an action, and the spell ends if you do so.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration is multiplied by 10 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Surging Resonance

m.text: a black pearl worth at least 500 gp, and a mithral bar worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You magically infuse the mithral bar into an object no larger than 1 foot in any dimension that you can touch. The object doesn't visibly change, but it holds the potential to interlope magical energy and can be detected by spells like detect magic.

The object triggers when a spell of level 4 or lower is cast and either the target or the caster is within 60 feet of the object. In addition to the triggering spell's effect, the caster has to roll on the {@table malicious magic surge table|Canbrew} and the spell ends.

Only one surging resonance can be active on an object at a time. Only one object imbued with surging resonance can trigger at a time for a spell. If there are more than one such objects within the trigger range, the closest one is expended.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, it can be triggered by spells up to the same level as the slot you use for the surging resonance.

spell.name: Spinning Blade Swarm
entries: You toss the metal coins in to the air, turning each into a spinning blade with 1 foot radius in an unoccupied space you can see within 5-feet range. Unless yuo give them a command, they hover in the same space until the duration ends. As a bonus action, you can make a ranged spell attack with a blade against a creature, loose object, or structure within the range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} slashing damage. The blade then disappears. This attack scores a critical hit if the number on the {@dice 1d20} is 18 or higher.
As an action on your subsequent turns, you can make another ranged spell attack with a blade.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can transmute two extra coins for each level above 5th.

table.name: Malicious Magic Surge Table
intro: This table is used by {@spell surging resonance|Canbrew} spell.
table.caption: Malicious Magic Surge Effects
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
Roll on this table twice, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
You cast {@spell fireball|PHB} spell centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell dragon's breath|XGE}. The number rolled on each die determines the damage type for that die. If you roll a 6 on a {@dice d6}, you choose the damage type for that die.
You cast {@spell ice storm|PHB} spell centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell confusion|PHB} centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell grease|PHB} centered on yourself.
You are transported to the Astral Plane until the end of your next turn, after which time you return to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
You switch positions with a random creature within 60 feet in a puff of smoke.

You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While a plant, you are {@condition incapacitated} and have vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 hit points, your pot breaks, and your form reverts.
For the next minute, you are moved 5 feet in random direction at the end of each of your turns.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
You cast {@spell entangle|PHB} centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell fog cloud|PHB} centered on yourself.
An illusory copy of you appears at a random location within 60 feet of you. At the start of your next turn, it runs to you and explodes, dealing {@damage 3d10} force damage in a 20 foot radius.
You become {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} hours. If you use an action to vomit and take {@damage 3d10} poison damage, then the {@condition poisoned} condition ends.
You glow with bright light in a 30-foot radius for the next minute. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
You cast {@spell stoneskin|PHB} on yourself. While the spell is active, your walking speed becomes 5 feet.
You cast {@spell polymorph|PHB} on yourself. If you fail the saving throw, you turn into a {@creature sheep|SKT} for the spell's duration.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to piercing damage for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to slashing damage for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to bludgeoning damage for the next minute.

You feel the incredible urge to relieve yourself. Until you do, your Strength and Intelligence are reduced by 1. If you don't relieve yourself in the next 2 minutes, the above effects are removed, but you have -4 to all Charisma checks for 1 hour or until you change your trousers.
The spell fails to take effect‚Ä¶ until {@dice 1d4} rounds later.

A force explodes out in a ring around you. Each creature within 30 ft. of you must make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature who failed the saving throw is knocked 5 ft. away from you.
All unsecured objects and creatures in a 100 ft radius are moved towards you by up to 15 feet if there is space available.
Roll again on this table and the resulted effect triggers at the location of the object imbued with surging resonance.

The caster loses containment of their magical power, which all goes pouring out to the nearest creature. The caster expends all of their remaining spell slots and sorcery points, adding all the spell levels together (with each sorcery point counting as 1 level). The target takes {@damage 1d6} force damage for each spell level expended this way. If this damage kills the target, the leftover damage continues to the next closest creature, and so on until all damage has been applied.
Everyone in a {@dice 3d6} foot radius has to make a DC 15 Con save or falls asleep for {@dice 1d4} rounds.
Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt.

subclass.name: Oath of the Dragon Knight
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Dragon Knight|Paladin||Dragon Knight|Canbrew|3
Aura of the Dragon Queen (Chromatic Sovereign only)|Paladin||Dragon Knight|Canbrew|7
Aura of the Platinum Dragon (Metallic Sovereign only)|Paladin||Dragon Knight|Canbrew|7

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Dragon Knight
entries: Dragons are some of the most powerful creatures in the multiverse, and you seek to emulate their majesty in all that you do. Whether you wish to use and exercise a dragon‚Äôs power, help it extend its influence and change the world, or simply fell in love with the mighty creature and its ideals, you agree that dragonkind has its role to play in the great battles of this world. You have made an oath with an ancient or older dragon that has become your sovereign.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the Dragon Knight|Paladin||Dragon Knight|Canbrew|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Dragon Knight
entries: Though the exact words and strictures of the Oath of Dragon Knight vary, paladins of this oath share the following tenets, with some based on your dragon sovereign.

entries.name: Majesty
entries: I shall not bring shame to my sovereign, and I will behave in a way befitting of my status. I will be proud.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: I will gather wealth and unique items, both for my endeavors and for my sovereign. Regardless if they call me greedy. One never has enough riches.

entries.name: Power
entries: (Chromatic sovereign only) What good is power if it is not used? I shall use my power to advance the goals of my sovereign and myself, and remove those who oppose me.

entries.name: Goodwill
entries: (Metallic sovereign only) I shall not confuse arrogance and pride, nor shall I think myself above helping the weak and the weary.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Dragon Knight Spells

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Sovereign
entries: At 3rd level, when you choose this oath, you choose one type of dragon as your sovereign. The damage type associated with each dragon is used by features of this Oath. Additionally, you have learned to speak, read and write Draconic.
When you deal damage with your Divine Smite or Improved Divine Smite class features, the damage type is the one associated with your Sovereign.

Additionally, when you suffer damage of the type associated with your Sovereign, you may now use the absorb elements spell once without expending a spell slot to gain resistance to that damage type. You regain the ability to cast it this way after finishing a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Frightening Presence
entries: As an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to exude a terrifying presence. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw if it can see you. On a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. If a creature {@condition frightened} by this effect ends its turn more than 30 feet away from you, it can attempt another Wisdom saving throw to end the effect on it.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Wing Buffet
entries: As an action, you summon radiant wings that create a strong wind. Each enemy creature in a 20-foot cone, which originates from you, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they are knocked back 15 feet and fall prone, and if they encounter a solid obstacle take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage. On a success, they are instead knocked back 5 feet. Also, as part of this action, you can choose to ride the wind you have created and move 15 feet in any single direction.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Dragon Queen (Chromatic sovereign only)
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you imbue your own weapons and those of your allies with the elemental fury of your Dragon Sovereign. When you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it will deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the damage type associated with your Sovereign. A creature can benefit from this feature from only one paladin at a time. You must be conscious to grant this boon.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Platinum Dragon (Metallic sovereign only)
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your devotion grants you and those around you the divine protection of your dragon Sovereign. You reduce incoming non-magical physical damage to yourself and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Creatures may only reduce damage this way once per turn. A creature can benefit from this feature from only one paladin at a time. You must be conscious to grant this boon.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Blood
entries: At 15th level, you gain resistance to the damage type of your Sovereign. If you couple this resistance with {@spell absorb elements|XGE} spell, you take no damage from the damaging effect. Also, when you deal that type of damage, you ignore resistances.

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Avatar
entries: At 20th level you can, as an action, transform yourself into an {@5etools adult dragon|https://5e.tools/bestiary.html#adult%20red%20dracolich_tce,flstsource:ai=0~bgdia=0~bam=0~canbrew=0~cm=0~crcotn=0~cos=0~dc=0~dip=0~dmg=0~erlw=0~esk=0~egw=0~ftd=0~gos=0~ggr=0~hotdq=0~hftt=0~idrotf=0~jttrc=0~kkw=0~lox=0~lmop=0~mpmm=0~mtf=0~mot=0~oota=0~phb=0~pota=0~sdw=0~sja=0~skt=0~slw=0~scc=0~tftyp=0~tce=0~hol=0~rmbre=0~oow=0~rot=0~wbtw=0~toa=0~tod=0~vrgr=0~vgm=0~wdh=0~wdmm=0~xge=0,flopsource:extend,flstdragon%20age:adult=1,flopdragon%20age:extend,sublistselected:%7b%22items%22%3a%5b%5d%2c%22sources%22%3a%5b%5d%2c%22saveid%22%3a%222e913123-55a0-45bf-b59b-07ef2fb3e31f%22%7d} matching the type of your Sovereign for 1 minute. You count as under the effect of a {@spell polymorph|PHB} spell for the duration but you retain Intelligence, Wizdom, and Charisma scores. You may end your transformation early by using a bonus action on your turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
